benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoicePayments - Trigger a payment for all unpaid invoices

covered: POST Method - Valid request flows: Success with only required header (TC01), with all optional params (TC02), with partial/total/greater-than-total amounts (TC02–TC04), and when there is nothing to pay (TC06, TC07, TC29).

Input validation and invalid payloads: Malformed/non-existent accountId (TC08, TC09), missing/empty required header (TC10, TC16), invalid paymentMethodId (TC11), invalid paymentAmount (TC12), malformed targetDate (TC13), invalid boolean (TC14), invalid pluginProperty type (TC15), extra unknown params handling (TC25).
Duplicate submission/retry behavior: Transient network errors and post-processing retries without duplicate payments (TC22, TC28).
Large inputs: Extremely large paymentAmount and large pluginProperty arrays (TC23, TC24).
Server error handling: Gateway down (TC18), DB down (TC19), plugin system unavailable (TC27).
Query parameters coverage: Presence/absence and combinations of paymentMethodId, externalPayment, paymentAmount, targetDate, pluginProperty (TC01–TC05, TC25).
Headers: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy validated; optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment exercised (TC01, TC02, TC10, TC16).
Security hardening: SQL injection in path and XSS in pluginProperty do not leak or execute (TC20, TC21).
Performance/operability: Response-time under normal/peak load and resource utilization under stress (TC30–TC32).
gaps: Rate limiting/throttling: No scenarios validating 429 behavior or backoff when many rapid requests are made.
Concurrency on the same resource: No test for two concurrent payment triggers for the same account ensuring no double charge and proper locking/idempotency.

paymentMethodId semantics: No scenario where externalPayment=false and a non-default valid paymentMethodId is provided to verify that method is used. Also missing case where paymentMethodId does not belong to the account.
No-default-payment-method path: Missing scenario where account lacks a default payment method and paymentMethodId is not provided (expected error/behavior unspecified).
Target date semantics and time zones: No coverage for past vs future targetDate, boundary at day changes, or timezone offsets/format variants (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD vs full ISO-8601).
Monetary precision and currency rules: No tests for decimal precision, rounding, or currency mismatches when paymentAmount has fractional cents.
Response headers and content: 204 responses typically have no body; tests do not assert absence of body, Content-Type, or other headers (e.g., no-cache) as applicable.
Idempotency key/header (if supported): Not exercised to guarantee safe retries beyond network-error scenarios.
Business partitioning/ownership checks: Not verifying that pluginProperty values are properly encoded/escaped and that duplicates or very long entries are handled within documented limits.
Auditability: No verification that X-Killbill-Reason/Comment are persisted to audit logs/history.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests: burst of requests to the same endpoint/account; assert 429 or documented behavior and retry-after headers.
Add concurrency tests on the same account: fire two POSTs simultaneously; assert only one payment is created and the other is rejected or becomes a no-op with appropriate status.

Add a scenario using a valid non-default paymentMethodId with externalPayment=false to assert that the chosen method is used; add a case where the method belongs to a different account to assert 400/404.
Add a scenario where the account has no default payment method and no paymentMethodId is provided; assert expected error code and message.
Expand targetDate tests: past date, future date, timezone offsets (e.g., 2025-01-01T00:00:00Z vs 2025-01-01), and invalid but well-formed dates (e.g., 2025-02-30).
Add monetary precision tests: paymentAmount with high precision decimals, rounding behavior, and boundary values at min/max allowed; verify no over-collection and correct rounding.
Validate response headers on 204: assert empty body, appropriate Content-Type (or absence), and any required headers per API spec.
If the API supports idempotency keys, add tests to include an Idempotency-Key header and verify repeated requests with the same key do not duplicate payments.
Harden pluginProperty tests: very long strings, URL-encoded and UTF-8 characters, duplicate keys, and ensure server enforces documented limits and sanitization without breaking plugins.
Add audit assertions: after success, query audit logs/history to ensure X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment are captured as expected.
